item.name: hrMemorySize
item.description: The amount of physical read-write main memory, typically RAM, contained by the host.

item.name: hrMemoryUsed
item.description: The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated.

item.name: hrProcessorLoad7
item.description: The average, over the last seven minutes, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle.

item.name: hrSwapSize
item.description: The amount of swap memory

item.name: hrSwapUsed
item.description: The amount of used swap memory

item.name: hrSystemMaxProcesses
item.description: The maximum number of process contexts this system can support. If there is no fixed maximum, the value should be zero. On systems that have a fixed maximum, this object can help diagnose failures that occur when this maximum is reached.

item.name: hrSystemNumUsers
item.description: The number of user sessions for which this host is storing state information. A session is a collection of processes requiring a single act of user authentication and possibly subject to collective job control.

item.name: hrSystemProcesses
item.description: The number of process contexts currently loaded or running on this system.

item.name: pfCounterBadOffset
item.description: Number of packets with bad offset.

item.name: pfCounterFragment
item.description: Number of fragmented packets.

item.name: pfCounterMatch
item.description: Number of packets that matched a filter rule.

item.name: pfCounterMemDrop
item.description: Number of packets dropped due to memory limit limitations.

item.name: pfCounterNormalize
item.description: Number of normalized packets.

item.name: pfCounterShort
item.description: Number of short packets.

item.name: pfLimitsFrags
item.description: Maximum number of 'scrub' rules in the ruleset.

item.name: pfLimitsSrcNodes
item.description: Maximum number of 'sticky-address' or 'source-track' rulesin the ruleset.

item.name: pfLimitsStates
item.description: Maximum number of 'keep state' rules in the ruleset.

item.name: pfLogInterfaceIp4BytesIn
item.description: Number of IPv4 bytes passed in on the log interface.

item.name: pfLogInterfaceIp4BytesOut
item.description: Number of IPv4 bytes passed out on the log interface.

item.name: pfLogInterfaceIp4PktsInDrop
item.description: Number of IPv4 packtes dropped coming in on the log interface.

item.name: pfLogInterfaceIp4PktsInPass
item.description: Number of IPv4 packets passed in on the log interface.

item.name: pfLogInterfaceIp4PktsOutDrop
item.description: Number of IPv4 packets dropped going out on the log interface.

item.name: pfLogInterfaceIp4PktsOutPass
item.description: Number of IPv4 packets passed out on the log interface.

item.name: pfLogInterfaceName
item.description: The name of the interface configured with 'set log interface'. If no interface has been configured, the object will be empty.

item.name: pfStateTableCount
item.description: Number of entries in the state table.

item.name: pfStateTableInserts
item.description: Number of entries inserted into the state table.

item.name: pfStateTableRemovals
item.description: Number of entries removed from the state table.

item.name: pfStateTableSearches
item.description: Number of Searches against the state table.

item.name: pfStatusRunning
item.description: True if pf is currently enabled.

item.name: pfStatusRuntime
item.description: Indicates how long pf has been enabled. If pf is not currently enabled, indicates how long it has been disabled. If pf has not been enabled or disabled since the system was started, the value will be "0".

item.name: pfTablesTblNumber
item.description: The number of tables on this system.

item.name: pfTablesTblSSHlockoutCount
item.description: The number of addresses in the table "sshlockout". ** IMPORTANT ** This table can indicate that someone is trying to force SSH authentication.

item.name: pfTimeoutsAdaptiveEnd
item.description: When reaching this number of state entries, all timeouts values become zero, effectively purging all state entries immediately.

item.name: pfTimeoutsAdaptiveStart
item.description: When the number of state entries exceeds this value, adaptive scaling begins.

item.name: pfTimeoutsFragment
item.description: Seconds before an unassembled fragment is expired.

item.name: pfTimeoutsIcmpError
item.description: State after an ICMP error came back in response to an ICMP packet.

item.name: pfTimeoutsIcmpFirst
item.description: State after the first packet.

item.name: pfTimeoutsInterval
item.description: Interval between purging expired states and fragments.

item.name: pfTimeoutsOtherFirst
item.description: State after the first packet.

item.name: pfTimeoutsOtherMultiple
item.description: State if both hosts have sent packets.

item.name: pfTimeoutsOtherSingle
item.description: State if the source host sends more than one packet but the destination host has never sent one.

item.name: pfTimeoutsSrcNode
item.description: Lenght of time to retain a source tracking entry after the last state expires.

item.name: pfTimeoutsTcpClosed
item.description: State after one endpoint sends an RST.

item.name: pfTimeoutsTcpClosing
item.description: State after the first FIN has been sent.

item.name: pfTimeoutsTcpEstablished
item.description: The fully established state.

item.name: pfTimeoutsTcpFinWait
item.description: State after both FINs have been exchanged and the connection is closed.

item.name: pfTimeoutsTcpFirst
item.description: State after the first packet in a connection.

item.name: pfTimeoutsTcpOpening
item.description: State before the destination host ever sends a packet.

item.name: pfTimeoutsUdpFirst
item.description: State after the first packet.

item.name: pfTimeoutsUdpMultiple
item.description: State if both hosts have sent packets.

item.name: pfTimeoutsUdpSingle
item.description: State if the source host sends more than one packet but the destination host has never sent one.

item.name: sysContact
item.description: The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person.

item.name: SysDescr
item.description: A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software. It is mandatory that this only contain printable ASCII characters.

item.name: sysLocation
item.description: The physical location of this node (e.g, 'telephone closet, 3rd floor' ).

item.name: sysName
item.description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name.

item.name: sysUptime
item.description: The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

discovery_rule.name: Disk partitions
discovery_rule.description:
The rule will discover all dis partitions matching the global regexp "Storage devices for SNMP discovery".
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Description of storage $1
item_prototype.description: A description of the type and instance of the storage described by this entry.

item_prototype.name: Total disk space on $1
item_prototype.description: The size of the storage represented by this entry.

item_prototype.name: Used disk space on $1
item_prototype.description: The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated.

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description:
You may also consider using IF-MIB::ifType or IF-MIB::ifAlias for discovery depending on your filtering needs.
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Admin status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The desired state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Description of interface $1
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the interface hardware/software.

item_prototype.name: Inbound errors on interface $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: Incoming traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets in valid MAC frames received on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: Operational status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Outbound errors on interface $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that could not be transmitted because of errors.

item_prototype.name: Outgoing traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets transmitted in MAC frames on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: Physical address of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The interface's address at the protocol layer immediately 'below' the network layer in the protocol stack. For serial line this object should contaion an octet string of zero lenght

item_prototype.name: pfInterfaces4BytesInBlock $1
item_prototype.description: The number of IPv4 bytes blocked coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: pfInterfaces4BytesInPass $1
item_prototype.description: The number of IPv4 bytes passed coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: pfInterfaces4BytesOutBlock $1
item_prototype.description: The number of IPv4 bytes blocked going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: pfInterfaces4BytesOutPass $1
item_prototype.description: The number of IPv4 bytes passed going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: pfInterfaces4PktsInBlock $1
item_prototype.description: The number of IPv4 packets blocked coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: pfInterfaces4PktsInPass $1
item_prototype.description: The number of IPv4 packets passed coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: pfInterfaces4PktsOutBlock $1
item_prototype.description: The number of IPv4 packets blocked going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: pfInterfaces4PktsOutPass $1
item_prototype.description: The number of IPv4 packets passed going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: pfInterfacesDesc $1
item_prototype.description: the name of the interface.

item_prototype.name: pfInterfacesRefsRule $1
item_prototype.description: The number of rules referencing this interface.

item_prototype.name: pfInterfacesRefsState $1
item_prototype.description: The number of state and/or source track entries referencing this interface.
